title: Václav Zelený
text: Václav Zelený (August 18, 1936, <a href="Prague">Prague</a>, Czechoslovakia – November 3, 2020) was a Czech <a href="Botany">botanist</a> and university teacher. Václav Zelený was born in 1936 in Prague. In 1959 he graduated from the <a href="Faculty%20of%20Science%20of%20Charles%20University%20in%20Prague">Faculty of Science of Charles University in Prague</a>. He then worked at the <a href="Sugar%20Research%20Institute%20%28Czech%20Republic%29">Sugar Research Institute</a> in Prague, Modřany and from 1962 he worked as an assistant professor at the Department of Botany and Plant Physiology of the <a href="Czech%20University%20of%20Life%20Sciences%20Prague">Czech University of Life Sciences Prague</a>. During his tenure, he published several books concerning his specializations, which were the <a href="flora">flora</a> of <a href="Podblanicko%20region">Podblanicko region</a> and the flora of the <a href="Mediterranean%20Basin">Mediterranean</a>. These are mainly the publications Plants of the Mediterranean (in <a href="Czech%20language">Czech</a> "Rostliny Středozemí"), Nature of Vlašim Castle Park: Vlašim Castle and Park and Castle Parks and Memorial Trees of Podblanicko ("Příroda vlašimského zámeckého parku: zámek a park Vlašim" a "Zámecké parky a památné stromy Podblanicka)"; as a co-author he also contributed to a large publication published by <a href="Academia">Academia</a> entitled Useful Plants of the Tropics and Subtropics ("Užitkové rostliny tropů a subtropů)" or to the Flora of the Czech Republic ("Květena České republiky"). He wrote almost 40 articles for <a href="%C5%BDiva%20%28journal%29">Živa</a> magazine. Václav Zelený was a member of several organizations, such as the <a href="Czech%20Botanical%20Society">Czech Botanical Society</a>, the <a href="Blan%C3%ADk%20Protected%20Landscape%20Area">Blaník Protected Landscape Area</a>, the <a href="Vietnamese%20Society">Vietnamese Society</a> and the <a href="Latin%20American%20Society">Latin American Society</a>.
